Welcome to RestAPI_app’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

The lifespan function is a coroutine that runs before and after the application. It’s used to initialize and close resources, such as database connections.

Parameters:

app – Pass the fastapi instance to the function

Returns:

An object that can be used to clean up the resources when the server shuts down

main.read_root()¶

The read_root function returns a dictionary with the key ‘message’ and value &quot;Contact manager API&quot;.

Returns:

A dictionary

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, user: User, db: Session) → ContactResponse¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Define the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • user – Get the user id from the token

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contactresponse object

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → None¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Identify the contact to be deleted

  • user – Get the user id from the database

  • db – Connect to the database

Returns:

None

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse] | None¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – Get the user id

  • db – Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday within the next 7 days

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactResponse¶

The get_contact function returns a single contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Specify the id of the contact we want to get

  • user – Check if the user is authorized to access the contact

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

A ContactResponse object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str | None, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The get_contact_by_email function returns a list of contacts that match the email address provided. If no email is provided, all contacts are returned.

Parameters:

  • email – Filter the query by email

  • user – Get the user id of the logged in user

  • db – Connect to the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user. The function takes in three parameters: skip, limit, and user. Skip is an integer that determines how many contacts to skip over before returning results. Limit is an integer that determines how many results to return after skipping over the specified number of contacts. User is a User object containing information about the current logged-in user.

Parameters:

  • skip – Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – Get the user_id from the user object

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_name(name: str | None, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The get_contacts_by_name function returns a list of contacts that match the name parameter. If no name is provided, all contacts are returned.

Parameters:

  • name – Filter the contacts by name

  • user – Get the user_id from the user object

  • db – Connect to the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the name and user_id

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_surname(surname: str | None, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The get_contacts_by_surname function returns a list of contacts with the given surname.

Parameters:

  • surname – Define the type of data that will be passed into the function

  • user – Get the user id from the database

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects

async src.repository.contacts.raise_contact_not_found()¶

The raise_contact_not_found function raises a 404 Not Found error with the message ‘Contact not found’.

Returns:

A response object with the status code 404 and a detail message

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → ContactResponse¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • user – Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

A contactresponse object

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact_fields(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateFields, user: User, db: Session) → ContactResponse¶

The update_contact_fields function updates the fields of a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Find the contact in the database

  • body – Pass the data from the request body to this function

  • user – Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Create a database session

Returns:

The updated contact

Parameters:

  • email – Get the email of the user

  • db – Create a database session

Returns:

None

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

Parameters:

  • email – Pass the email of a user to the function

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user that matches the email address

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Identify the user in the database

  • url – Get the url of the avatar from the request body

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – Identify the user in the database

  • token – Update the user’s refresh token

  • db – Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

  • curr_user – Get the user that is currently logged in

  • db – Pass the database session to the repository layer

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip – Skip a certain amount of contacts

  • limit – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • curr_user – Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact(name: str | None = Query(None), surname: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), curr_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The search_contact function allows the user to search for contacts by name, surname or email.

Parameters:

  • name – Specify that the name parameter is optional

  • surname – Get the surname from the query string

  • email – Search for a contact by email

  • curr_user – Get the current user

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects, depending on the query parameters

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, curr_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → ContactResponse¶

  • body – Get the contact information from the request body

  • curr_user – Get the current user

  • db – Access the database

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – Get the token from the url

  • db – Get the database connection

Returns:

A dictionary with message ‘Your email is already confirmed’ or ‘Email confirmed’

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – Get the token from the request header

  • db – Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link to confirm their account.

The function takes in the body of the request, which contains only one field: email. It then uses this information to query for a user in our database and if it finds one, sends them an email with a link that they can use to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Create a database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message ‘Check your email for confirmation’ or ‘Your email already confirmed’

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Get the base url of the server

  • db – Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A dictionary

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

The Auth class is used to hash passwords, create tokens, and verify tokens.

ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(username: str)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – Identify the user

Returns:

A token, which is a string

async create_email_token(email: str)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token for the given email. The token is valid for 7 days and has the ‘email_scope’ scope.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • email – Specify the email address of the user

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(username: str)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – Create a refresh token for the user

Returns:

A refresh token that expires in 7 days

async create_token(username: str, delta: timedelta, scope: str)¶

The create_token function creates a JWT token with the payload

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – Create a payload with the username

  • delta – Set the time when the token will expire

  • scope – Determine the scope of the token

Returns:

A jwt token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is requesting a new access token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first decodes the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checks to make sure that the scope is correct. If it is not, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’. If everything goes well, we return payload[‘sub’], which contains the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address from the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password, and returns True if the plain-text password matches the hashed

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the plain text password that the user has entered

  • hashed_password – Pass in the hashed password from the database

Returns:

True if the password is correct and False otherwise

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account.

Parameters:

  • email – Pass the email address to send the email to

  • username – Pass the username of the user to be sent an email

  • host – Pass the host name of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

REST API database DB¶

src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function opens a new database connection if there is none yet for the current application context. It will also create the database tables we need for our models if they don’t exist yet.

Returns:

A database session
